description: Borrowed from Italian ridotto (“foyer”). Doublet of redoubt.

nouns.description: ridotto (plural ridottos or ridottoes or ridotti)

entries.meaning: (historical) A public ball, typically a masquerade, popular in the 18th century.
examples: There are to be ridottos at guinea tickets.

entries.meaning: (music) An arrangement or abridgment of a piece from the full score.
